comments: Also, number of primes between p(n) and p(p(n)) inclusive, where p(k) is the k-th prime. - _Zak Seidov_, Sep 22 2003Since a(n+1)-a(n)=p(n+1)-p(n)-1>=1 the sequence is monotonic.n-th prime minus n-th nonnegative integer. [From _Juri-Stepan Gerasimov_, Feb 09 2010]
example: p(1) = 2, p(p(1)) = p(2) = 3 and there are two primes between 2 and 3 inclusive.
author: _Mohammad K. Azarian_
extensions: More terms from Andrew J. Gacek (andrew(AT)dgi.net)
Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 07 2007
